review: My Fire TV worked fantastically for about a month.  All of a sudden one day it stopped holding a wifi connection.  I hadn't changed its location, nor that of my router.  I tried every troubleshooting thing possible, until I finally broke down and contacted Amazon about it.  They had me go through all of the same things I had already done - to no avail.  Ultimately, they shipped me a replacement since we couldn't get mine to work anymore.  I set up the new one and - SAME THING!  Would connect to the internet, then lose the connection - rinse and repeat.  I racked my brain over what the problem was, and that's when I remembered that I had recently plugged in my DVD player, which the Fire TV was sitting on top of.  I pulled it out from under the Fire TV box, and voila!Moral of the story - DVD players have magnets in them that interfere with the wifi connection to the Fire TV box!  If you find that you are having a connection problem and none of the troubleshooting is working, look for items near that box that may contain magnets!  Hope this helps alleviate some frustration for someone!
